title: Reading from and writing to files
p: The class Core::IO::File::Stream provides an independent platform interface for reading from and writing to files. All filenames passed to this interface must be UTF-8 encoded. This class can be used as a data stream (like Yuni::String or std::cout). Contrary to some other implementations, this class reads and writes data 'as it'. That means that no conversion is performed when reading or writing.
Closing a file is implicit. It is automatically closed at the destruction of the object or when opening another file.
This example reads each file given from the command line and write them to the console (std::cout).
h2: Reading a file line by line
p: This exemple is the same as before, except we will read the file line by line and printing the line number in the same time.
Writing into a file is as simple as writing to any data stream. This exemple will write "Hello world !\n" into a filename given from the command line.
Any datatype that a Yuni::String understands can be used here.
